title: The Night Cricket Died
byline: Today cricket is no longer the gentleman’s game, but another form of sport in the hands of the International Cricket Council (ICC) that is now under Indian influence to do as it pleases and the catastrophic results are now showing.

title: Mahanayaka Thera’s decry propaganda ahead of Diyawadana Nilame election
byline: The prelates appealed to all parties to refrain from engaging in propaganda based on personal agendas and hatred.

title: Pakistan v UAE Asia Cup match delayed amid India handshake row
byline: Pakistan’s Asia Cup match with the United Arab Emirates was delayed by at least one hour on Wednesday as the fallout rumbles on from a handshake row with arch-rivals India.

title: Government to commence petroleum exploration: President
byline: The government will commence petroleum exploration with the assistance of scientists and experts in the field, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Probe launched over unpaid Basmati rice consignments worth Rs. 27 million
byline: The Colombo Fraud Investigation Division today informed Colombo Additional Magistrate Lahiru Silva that an investigation has been launched into the alleged misappropriation of 75 metric tons of Basmati rice imported from a Pakistani company, valued at Rs. 27.41 million without making due payments.

title: Suspension of mineral transport during school hours amended: GSMB
byline: The Geological Survey and Mines Bureau (GSMB) has revoked the suspension of transporting minerals during school hours.

title: Sri Lanka’s 3rd nanosatellite to be launched into orbit on Friday
byline: Sri Lanka’s third nanosatellite, BIRDS-X DRAGONFLY, developed with technical contributions from Sri Lankan engineers, is scheduled to be launched into orbit on September 19 at 2.15 p.m. Sri Lanka time.

title: Positive sentiment drives CSE higher: capital goods sector dominates
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) continued its bullish run for the second consecutive day, with the ASPI advancing 156.05 points (+0.76%) to close at 20,775.42, while the S&P SL20 rose 34.89 points (+0.59%) to 5,903.00.

title: 350 megawatt added to national grid
byline: The ceremonial synchronisation of the Kerawalapitiya “Sobadhanavi” 350 megawatt (MW) LNG Power Plant took place a short while ago, graced by Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya and Minister of Energy Engineer Kumara Jayakody.

title: Ex-Arsenal star Thomas Partey denies rape charges
byline: Former Arsenal footballer Thomas Partey has denied raping two women and sexually assaulting a third woman.

title: Scheduled water-cut in Colombo cancelled
byline: The 9-hour water cut scheduled in Colombo for tomorrow has been cancelled, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) announced today.

title: Warner Bros. to launch HBO max in Sri Lanka
byline: Warner Bros. Discovery yesterday announced that its premier global streaming service HBO Max will launch direct-to-consumer in new markets across Asia Pacific on October 15, including Bangladesh, Brunei, Cambodia, Laos, Macau, Mongolia, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

title: Adani-led Sri Lanka container terminal to double capacity ahead of deadline
byline: India’s Adani Group and its partners are set to double the capacity of a $840 million container terminal in Colombo months ahead of schedule, despite relinquishing $553 million in U.S. funding, an executive at partner firm John Keells Holdings told Reuters.

title: Sri Lankan passport slips to 97th in Global Ranking
byline: Sri Lanka’s passport has dropped one place to 97th in the Henley Passport Index 2025 Global Ranking, released on September 11.

title: Week-long mobile services for private and semi-public sector employees
byline: Special mobile service programs will be conducted at all district and sub-labor offices from September 22 to 26, 2025, to assist employees in the private and semi-public sectors, the Labour Department announced.

title: Pothuhera–Rambukkana Expressway section to be ready before 2028
byline: The Pothuhera to Rambukkana section of the Central Expressway is expected to be completed before the Kadawatha to Mirigama stretch, with work slated for completion by the Sinhala and Tamil New Year in April 2028, Transport, Highways, Ports, and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Sri Lanka becomes state party to UN convention on the law of the sea
byline: Sri Lanka officially became a State Party to the United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea on the Conservation and Sustainable Use of Marine Biological Diversity of Areas Beyond National Boundaries after submitting its instrument of ratification to the United Nations yesterday (16), the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism announced.

title: Court sets date for Wimal Weerawansa assets case
byline: Colombo High Court Judge Lanka Jayaratne today ordered that the case against former Minister Wimal Weerawansa, filed over the alleged acquisition of assets worth more than Rs. 75 million, be taken up again for evidence on October 22.

title: Sri Lanka enters ‘new era’ under President Anura: Chinese Ambassador
byline: Chinese Ambassador to Sri Lanka Qi Zhenhong extended warm congratulations on the resumption of construction of the Kadawatha–Meerigama section of the Central Expressway, said that Sri Lanka has entered a “new era” following the election of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Nuwan Climbs to No.6 in ICC T20I Bowling Rankings
byline: Sri Lanka fast bowler Nuwan Thushara has made significant progress in the ICC Men’s T20I Bowling Rankings, rising six places to secure the No.6 position.

title: Gammanpila’s petition against arrest to be heard on September 24
byline: A writ petition filed by former Parliamentarian Udaya Gammanpila, seeking an order to prevent his arrest by the CID over a recent statement he made to the media, was today fixed for September 24 by the Court of Appeal.

title: UNP decides to reinstate membership of those who joined SJB
byline: The United National Party (UNP) working committee has decided to reinstate the membership of those who had joined the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) back in 2020.

title: U.S., SL Navy open state-of-the-art lab  in Trincomalee
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka, in partnership with the Sri Lanka Navy, officially opened a state-of-the-art English Language Lab at the Naval and Maritime Academy in Trincomalee on September 15.

title: Sampath Manamperi surrenders to Court
byline: Sampath Manamperi, who was wanted in connection with the discovery of two containers of chemicals suspected to be used in the manufacture of the drug “Ice” in the Middeniya area, surrendered to the Walasmulla Magistrate’s Court today.

title: President reveals politicians’ links to underworld figures
byline: Information has surfaced linking certain Members of Parliament and former ministers to underworld figures, some of whom were arrested recently in Indonesia, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake said today.

title: Andy Pycroft removed from all Pakistan matches in Asia Cup
byline: Richie Richardson will replace Andy Pycroft as match referee for Pakistan’s Asia Cup game against UAE after PCB’s protest to ICC, according to the board sources.

title: Kidney diseases claim 1,600 lives annually
byline: Kidney diseases cause around 1,600 deaths in Sri Lanka each year, averaging five deaths daily, the Health Promotion Bureau said.

title: Deputy Minister Chathuranga Abeysinghe concludes visit to China
byline: At the invitation of the China Council for the Promotion of International Trade (CCPIT), Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Industry and Entrepreneurship Development, Chathuranga Abeysinghe, completed a four-day official visit to Sichuan Province, China, aimed at deepening economic cooperation and enhancing bilateral trade relations.

title: CAA raids traders selling rice above controlled prices; Rs. 95 million in fines imposed
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) has intensified raids across the country to crack down on traders selling rice at prices higher than the government’s maximum retail price.

title: Construction of Kadawatha–Meerigama highway section commences
byline: The construction of the Kadawatha–Meerigama section of the highway officially commenced today (September 17) at 10:00 a.m., under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake

title: Pakistan beat UAE to set up India rematch in Asia Cup
byline: Pakistan set up another politically charged showdown with arch-rivals India at the Asia Cup after defeating the United Arab Emirates by 41 runs in Dubai on Wednesday.

title: ’Fixing Sri Lanka Rugby’
byline: Ex-Sri Lanka Rugby Captain Pavithra Fernando has major plan for medal at Asian Games, World Cup qualification in 2035 and leading Sri Lanka to a new era sans personal squabbles

title: 'Fixing Sri Lanka Rugby'
byline: Ex-Sri Lanka Rugby Captain Pavithra Fernando has major plan for medal at Asian Games, World Cup qualification in 2035 and leading Sri Lanka to a new era sans personal squabbles

title: Sri Lanka can Qualify with Win or NRR Edge
byline: Group B goes down to the wire as Sri Lanka take on Afghanistan on September 18. A win guarantees Sri Lanka a Super Four spot, but net run rate could also decide the outcome. Bangladesh’s fate hangs in the balance, making this a high-stakes clash.
